com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.roads.attribute
Class KeywordParser

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.vividsolutions.jcs.conflate.roads.attribute.KeywordParser
Direct Known Subclasses:
RoadKeywordParser
public class KeywordParser
extends java.lang.Object

   Main Attribute matching class
   Usage : 
      1. create new KeywordParser
      2. Add keyword information
      3. Parse a string (creates a KeywordMatches structure)
      4. use the KeywordMatches structure to compare two matches

      Typically #2 is done by sub classing the KeywordParser class (cf. RoadKeywordParser)

Method Detail

add

public void add(java.lang.String key,
                int codeNumber,
                java.lang.String elementType)
Add a new keyword to search for
ie. you want to find "rd", and label it as 'rd_type' 1.
.add("rd",1, "rd_type");
Parameters:
key - actual text to search for
codeNumber - unique id for this class of match
elementType - the class of this keyword

matchAll

public KeywordMatches matchAll(java.lang.String name)
Main parser function - given a string parse it.
Returns a list of possible matches - you'll probably
want to .unique() the result.
Parameters:
name - string to search for keywords in.

matchAll

public KeywordMatches matchAll(KeywordMatch oldmatch)
  Main work horse of the parser - this is recursive.
  
  Lets look at an example:
   "SW Marine Drive" + empty oldmatch
   match is done on "SW Marine Drive" and returns:
        SW + "Marine Drive"
        Drive + "SW Marine"
   These are added to the result
   Each of the results of the match is recursed
   
   -->  SW + "Marine Drive"
        match is done on "Marine Drive" and returns:
         {SW}  + Drive + "Marine"

   and so on
Parameters:
oldmatch - - any matches already found in the string

match

public KeywordMatches match(java.lang.String name)
does a non-recurive match on the string

match

public KeywordMatches match(KeywordMatch oldmatch)
Actual matching is done with this.
finds all the keywords in oldmatch.getText() and returns a list of new matches
NOTE: the new matches have the historical (ie. earlier matches) information
from oldmatch in them.
Parameters:
oldmatch - old KeywordMatch object to base the new matches on

removeMatches

public KeywordMatches removeMatches(java.lang.String full)
helper function - obliterate all the keywords in a string
BUG: will only remove 1st occurance of keyword in a string
ie. "st peters st" will return "peters st"
Parameters:
full - text to look for keywords in
